title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON)
Interview Descriptions: There were two panels.They were asking related to work-ethics question.Firstly they brief about their organization and Admission process.how they process the application and about their work environment.They discuss about experience and skill-set.
Interview Questions: Questions were regarding process,procedure,policy,communication,work environment

title: Exam Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviewers present in the panel asked 16 questions most of them were situational and behaviour questions. the interview was scheduled for one hour, at the beginning the review panel explained about the Job shortly and they asked 5-6 questions each.
Interview Questions: if you have disagreement with your supervisor on a matter, how would you react?

title: Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was a zoom interview with 2 employees within the administrative team at the school which lasted around 30 minutes (20 for their questions and 10 for mine). The questions were primarily behavioural and revolved around organization, conflict management, promotion, and engagement.
Interview Questions: Q: How do you stay motivated and engaged in the work that you do?

title: Software Student Position Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: Submit resume and cover letter then interview for 1 hour then sent admission and also offered another role on top of it all for the summer months which was very nice
Interview Questions: Don’t remember the questions asked

title: Residence Life Don Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward, they ask some questions about how you are involved in school and about your skillset. They ask questions specifically about the role, why you want to be in the role, and what you would do in certain scenarios. They then ask funny questions to learn about your personality and character. All around it is pretty relaxed.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a don?

title: Custodial Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Detailed, friendly and good length. Panel was present of professionals. Very down to earth folks and support seemed present!! It was virtual and still was made to have comfortable , I got another job offer so had to decline. I would come and apply again if given opportunity and needed a job.
Interview Questions: How to full clean a washroom

title: Research Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and efficient. Job was described well. There was a quick response time. I also needed to do a writing exercise which dovetailed well with the job function.  It was a great experience.
Interview Questions: To edit a grant proposal.

title: Audio Visual Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: It was a teams interview, with 3 managers after I got a confirmation of human resources, then I got several technical questions  and I answered as accurate as I could, most of them where real life cases
Interview Questions: I don't remember very technical

title: Graduate Research/Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: I did not have any interviews. They offered the position with an admission letter.  Usually, they review your transcripts and academic standing to decide if they want to give you a Teaching Assistant position.
Interview Questions: There is no interview questions.

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: A phone call from the department manager, basically asking general questions about how you would work with students, in a service-oriented environment. A few behavioral oriented questions as well as some personality questions.
Interview Questions: what was your biggest strength what change will you make why did you apply for this position

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: Forms you had to fill out related to the research, meeting with the prof, and then complete the interview by explaining the process of research. Once the forms are all filled out then you get contacted by the professor when he's done talking with the dean.
Interview Questions: How do you work in a team and alone?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: Short, need to know people to get in. Questions were direct. Was done over skype. Not much else to describe, they care about your personality a lot, less so experience since they teach it to you. Being an RA is doing grunt work.
Interview Questions: Describe a stressful situation you were in.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Two-step interview process. First interview is with a panel consisting of director level role within the department, staff counterpart and HR representative. If advanced, the second interview is with the executive you will be supporting.
Interview Questions: How do you manage shifting priorities?

title: Student Service Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: Customer service questions, background experience explanation, get to know the supervisor and manager, introduce yourself and your experience with skills. It's an easy interview, mostly customer service based similar to retail or any other part time job
Interview Questions:
How would you help someone who has more technical knowledge
How would you help someone with very little technical knowledge
What does customer service mean to you

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: one interview face to face, ask you some and your strength, general background information, working schedule and ask a few questions, employer who do interview very patient and friendly, doing an interview in a private and the quiet room with one single employer
Interview Questions: general questions about your background

title: Academic Writing Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: They gave me a piece of student work to edit, then we did an interview immediatley after. They asked me to walk them through how I would approach teaching my edits to the imaginary student who wrote the piece. Then asked typical interview questions.
Interview Questions: How would you explain how to use a semi colon to a student

title: Student Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: Good, easy questions. Nice Supervisor. Talk about a lot about the job itself. Interview on campus, follow the steps in the email that the supervisor send. Need to have a business dress
Interview Questions: If you could describe yourself in three words, what would it be?

title: Annual Giving Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: very easy phone interview. lasted about 10 minutes. role played a call with the interviewer (provided with script to practice before). followed by a few questions about you and your experience at the school.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: There is none they automatically select you for it, just get good grades and you will be asked to TA, You can either work 60 hours a semester or 120 depending on what they assign you.
Interview Questions: Which professor/ courses would like to teach.

title: Student Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the schools website and was contacted for an interview in person. I interviewed at the Athletic Complex and was given the offer the next week via email, very simple process.
Interview Questions: How would I manage the job?

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: Had me in for a first interview, which went well. Got called in for a second interview which went better than the first. Answered all questions honestly and well, we all laughed and had a good time, and they seemed quite happy with me. I was also very well qualified with years of administrative experience in Development. Then after a wait they said they did not want to move forward with my application, and posted the job again. I emailed HR asking for feedback on what went wrong, but they would not respond to me. They didn't even call my references, who would have definitely quelled any doubts. Very unprofessional to decline a good candidate with no reason, not hire someone better to post again, and then to not be willing to correspond with them after. Quite glad I was interviewing for multiple places as I am glad I ended up where I am rather than at a place that I now cannot respect.
Interview Questions: What makes you the best candidate for the position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Applied by emailing the professor with my resume. Interviewed with the lab manager at the school a couple weeks later. Was emailed a week later with an offer to start right away.
Interview Questions: What interests you about our research

title: Domestic Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was called for an in-person interview. Interviewed with 3 recruiters. The interview was approximately 20 minutes, with a 5 minute presentation you are told to prepare in advance. Asked fairly standard questions
Interview Questions: What experience do you have that would make you a good fit for this role?

title: Domestic Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I was asked to prepare a 3-5 minute oral presentation that would be for potential incoming high school students + their parents. 
Process was:  The presentation, followed by a few minutes of silence and note-taking, then ending with a Q/A including four questions from them as well as them asking if I had any questions.
Interview Questions: What was the most independent undertaking you have gone through?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
One hour in person panel interview
Set of about 8 questions in total
Same set of 8 given to all I found out later
Two questions were told to me in advance so I could prepare for it.
Interview Questions: Courses I wanted to teach

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: It is all done through application. You had to apply to the position and it was based on grades and merit. You had to be applying for the program and indicate that you were interested in applying to be  TA.
Interview Questions: There were no interview questions it was all done through application

title: Educational Technology Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Presented to hiring committee a training session that lasted for approximately 5 minutes. I sat for about 10-15 questions about technology and related experience by a committee that took notes and questioned how I would fit in from private sector to public sector. Was given wrong job description from beginning so I was left to figure out what the job was after hiring.
Interview Questions: Asked about experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: Brief, offer was mostly based on marks and academic courses taken since no previous research experience is likely. Informal interview just discussing the research conducted and your fit in the lab.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do research?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Meeting with department and HR staff. I submitted online, then sent an email directly to the department manager, who I had a contact in common with. I was asked to come for one in-person interview that lasted about one hour long. I was contact about one week later with a job offer. The offer was non-negotiable.
Interview Questions: Industry specific (tech qualifications). Situational (e.g., describe an experience where you had to....).

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is similar to that of any interview - HR involved, management. They ask many questions related to your existing skills and personality. Nothing too intimidating as long as you come in prepared
Interview Questions: N/A

title: International Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two interviewers, one from International Office, the other a mentor herself, both friendly and easy to talk to. They took a lot of notes and had a long list of prepared questions. Most questions are typical interview questions focusing on cultural sensitivity and communication skills. They also asked about my understanding of the position and related rules. We had a pleasant conversation anyways.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a mentee does not reply to any of your emails?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submit application form on-line at around Feb and get interview at end of semester. School will give feedback at around June. Before interview, student will receive a topic to prepare a short demonstration during interview.
Interview Questions: Why you think you fit this position?

title: Supervisor, Special Constable Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Useless round table discussion. There were 9 people in a shotgun style interview.  They didnt know what way was up.  Useless old farts on table and people who have never called police or whatever.  Thats why their organization sucks
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registrar Office Personnel Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview with a panel of 5 including HR Manager, perhaps 15 questions, 1 hr. Friendly and relaxed. Good questions. Enjoyed it. A very positive experience and panel provided helpful feedback following the decision. Got the feeling it would be a great place to work.
Interview Questions: What are the characteristics of co-workers that I most like and dislike working with.

title: S I Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted that I might be a good fit for the role. After submitting my cover letter and resume I was contacted for the interview. After finding a time that worked over email I ad the interview with two people. It was a very formal interview with lots of behaviour questions.
Interview Questions: If you could talk to two people dead or alive who would they be?

title: Annual Giving Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interview. First was a group interview.Questions were asked to see if you could think on the spot, reflect your personality and if you are able to talk about different topics.  Then a phone/ mock phone call interview.
Interview Questions: Be confident for the mock phone call interview and go into the script right away.

title: Library Research Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Apply online (via Navigator, the school's career webpage). One week later in person interview. As an international student, I have a few more steps in preparation: submit Eligibility Form to International Office, wait for approval; Apply Work On Campus Permit; Apply SSN
Interview Questions: What library/database resource do I know, what's my level of proficiency

title: Instructional Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The application form was first filled out online, where you gave basic information about yourself as well as which course(s) you wanted to apply for. All eligible applicants (based on past course completion and grades) were given a blank timetable to fill out. Those who were then short-listed were given a skill test in order to see if you remembered the material that would ultimately be studied in the course. Applicants with the highest scores were chosen - NO FORMAL INTERVIEW.
Interview Questions: Having to recall specific material that was taught to me long ago

title: Campus Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: You must apply online with your resume and cover letter. Then you are required to do a full day of carousel interviews which are mostly situational. After that about less than half will be asked back for a panel interview. The members are your 2 coordinators and the Welcome Centre Coordinator. They will ask you multiple questions and you are also required to do a creative part.
Interview Questions: My weaknesses, My strengths

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University
Interview Descriptions: Applied for a short term project. What is ur fav course? Are you detail focused? Very nice people.
Interview Questions: Time management skills

title: Stage Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: They only asked me right away when I'm available for work. There weren't any questions that were hard. The difficulty was very easy and not a lot about work. It was more like a conversation introducing myself. The most interview-like question was Where have you worked before.
Interview Questions: Where have you worked before?

title: Annual Giving Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Sent my resume and then had to pretend I was a caller during the interview (mock interview). Got the job shortly after. I believe at the time it was entirely over the phone - the job itself is in a call centre environment. They wanted to see how you sounded over the phone and how you could overcome difficult situations like if a prospect is not willing to donate. You need to try your best to politely convince the prospect why donating to the school is important.
Interview Questions: How do you handle objections?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wilfrid Laurier University (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied online at their website.  I was selected from the pool and brought in for the interview.  I waited 1 week to get a reply back from the application.  Then another week for the interview, and lastly another week for their decision.  I interviewed with 5 people.  They were fairly laid back.  They tried to put you at ease and were dressed down.  The questions were typical behavioural ones and standard where do you see yourself in 5 years and why are you a good fit?  Most questions dealt with the job description and duties though.  They had their list of questions and didn't go any further into them then what they had on their sheets.  It was difficult to address all members of the interview team as we were at an oval table and it was hard to make eye contact with all members throughout an answer.
Interview Questions: What are your goals for the future?
